verses.roman:
etan nigaditaṁ tāta
yat pṛṣṭo 'haṁ tavānagha
kapilasya ca saṁvādo
devahūtyāś ca pāvanaḥ

synonyms: etat—this; nigaditam—spoken; tāta—O dear Vidura; yat—which; pṛṣṭaḥ—was asked; aham—I; tava—by you; anagha—O sinless Vidura; kapilasya—of Kapila; ca—and; saṁvādaḥ—conversation; devahūtyāḥ—of Devahūti; ca—and; pāvanaḥ—pure.
translation: My dear son, since you have inquired from me, I have answered. O sinless one, the descriptions of Kapiladeva and His mother and their activities are the purest of all pure discourses.
